Pre-Game Insights: Ireland fans are thinking of getting relegated as a way to have better opposition and a chance to win games.
Heimir Hallgr√≠msson described the losing streak as a 'downward spiral'.
Some fans booed the final score of 0-2 against Greece and also booed Will Smallbone as man of the match and Matt Doherty as a 75th-minute sub.
Post-Match Reflections: Glenn Whelan said that the team hasn't given the fans anything to get off their seats.
Frank Lampard says he was driven on by the memory of being taunted by his fans at West Ham as he was stretchered off with a broken leg at the age of 18.
Brennan Johnson is in the form of his life after abuse from his supporters prompted him to delete his social media accounts.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The article discusses the relationship between the team and the fans, with some fans feeling that the team hasn't given them anything to get excited about.
The article also touches on the idea that some fans might be too down on the idea of losing and that they need to accept the team's performance.
The article mentions that some players might be demoralized by the fans' abuse.
Others: The article is written by Ken Early and published in The Irish Times.
The article discusses the Nations League games and Ireland's relegation showdown with Finland.
